messages.message: Whos ready to push AIHUB to the limits. 17mb PDF with 2297pgs!!!!!!! And we are off

So close. Looks like digitization finished but failed at a map_udf
 "job_id": "231aefe7-6115-4931-ada2-0abd1e3e9924",
45231b77df470fc4
Looks like we failed to create index. We share out a bit too much in the console window :slightly_smiling_face:
@lydia whom would be best to help tshoot this job and see if we can make it work. This will be for the BofA POC
A while ago, the team shared with me that we could index the Bible :smile: think that's the upper limit we tested
I do agree that OCR should be fine, indexing likely is the bottleneck here

For indexing we can go as far as -800 pages before hitting a timeout.  If we need to go beyond we need to parallelise indexing. We did not put in that change in for chunked parallel indexing with rate limit concerns on the embedding model with parallel calls. If this is a requirement for customer, we can add to our roadmap to add chunked parallel indexing.
We will need this for the BofA LLM POC kicking off in december
@Rakesh let's chat next week in our 1:1 on this
Feel free to use the free 2300 page pdf for testing :slightly_smiling_face:
@joshbronko can you work with the PM on some requirements for BofA LLM. the file size is only an approximation to the file content.

@Will McDermott is also looking at a commercial split-classification use case on bundles with 1000+ pages, so this would be useful for that use case as well. @Will McDermott if you already have an EPD ticket for handling 1000+ page files, can you link it to Josh's? Or if not, can you add your use case to his ticket? Knowing how many use cases this feature will impact will help us prioritize it
Thanks @lydia. I just added the link to my ticket in the comment thread. Does that work?
